page.title: 11PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: There are 12 pubs and clubs in the area. All the pubs are tied to breweries and the clubs are affiliated to the C.I.U. The oldest building is the Golden Lion at S.Hylton, over 300 years old whereas the Hastings Hill is only 18 years old. None of the managers had been in his present position more than 4 yrs.The number of customers ranged from 1,000 to 7,000 a week with Scotch beer being the most popular drink -up to 40 barrels a week in the busiest pub.All establishments offer pool, darts, dominoes and some also have discos,bingo and quiz nights. Some run football teams. All clubs have men only bars. All managers would prefer flexible opening hours. The Jolly Potter and The Shipwright's are named after significant local industries.
